text: agiocephaly 7.5% Ptosis 7.5% Seizures 7.5% Autosomal recessive inheritance - Basal ganglia calcification - Chilblain lesions - Feeding difficulties in infancy - Leukodystrophy - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough estimate of the percentage of patients who have that feature. T
